Sentencas: Cobalt-free layered perovskite as a promising mixed ionic electronic conductor cathode has shown outstanding performance in conventional oxygen-ion conducting solid oxide fuel cells (O-SOFCs), but not in next-generation proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells (H-SOFCs) due to insufficient oxygen vacancy so far.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: We propose a facile A-site doping strategy to enable higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher -performing protonic ceramic fuel cells at reduced temperatures.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: As proof of concept, two different typical A -site doping of mixed-rare-earth Nd and alkali-metal K in PrBaFe1.9Zn0.1O5+delta are chosen as potential H-SOFC cathode materials.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Pr0.8Nd0.2BaFe1.9Zn0.1O5+delta (PNBFZ) and PrBa0.9K0.1Fe1.9Zn0.1O5+delta (PBKFZ) layered perov-skite cathodes were synthesized using a nitrate-gel combustion method.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Both PNBFZ and PBKFZ have a layered perovskite structure and are chemically compatible with protonic BaZr0.1Ce0.7Y0.2O3-delta (BZCY) electrolyte.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Both Nd and K doping dramatically improve the electrical conductivities under operation temperatures.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Compared with PBKFZ, PNBFZ shows a lower average thermal expansion coefficient (TEC) of 13.9x10(-6) K-1, being thermally compatible with the BZCY electrolyte without cracks.
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: A-site doping in Fe-based layered perovskite cathodes promotes the single-cell output performance by around 100-26% at 550-700 degrees C, especially for the mixed-rare-earth doped PNBFZ with high peak power densities of 401-650 mW cm(-2).
Titulo: A-site doping enabled higher-oxygen-vacancy cobalt-free layered perovskite cathode for higher-performing protonic ceramic fuel cells
